Reviews.Title: It's tougher than my kid...
Reviews.Author: Ray Morris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my teenage daughter with cerebral palsy. She loves to take pictures, but falls down a lot. We went through several cameras, always buying cheap ones, knowing they'd break. This one is amazing! Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Is truly waterproof
Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: I was at the beach, and the tide was coming in (not that i was paying that any mind), and all of a sudden, a HUGE wave comes and washes over all my stuff. My camera was with it all; everything was recovered except for my camera. About 15-20 min later, though, the camera was washed up onto the beach. I turn it on, and low and behold, it still worked. It takes good pictures too. Very worth-while, in my case.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: Glenn Oliver Dettman
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to take any Pulitzer Prize winning photographs with  this camera, but it worked well enough for a vacation to the beach. Some have criticized it for the hard-to close waterproof latches, but I didn't have any problems with that. I also followed the suggestion of putting a little chap-stik on the seals to make sure to keep the water out. From a water proof perspective, it worked flawlessly, and we have both photos and video from under water on our vacation.The camera has lots of settings to experiment with, but we used it mostly on the "automatic" settings, with the exception of some sunrise/sunset photos. All the pictures came out well enough for snapshots, but there are certainly better cameras when it comes to image quality.The difference between video recording times in standard vs high quality is pretty significant. 30 minutes for standard, and about 12 for HD.For what I needed (inexpensive underwater camera), I am very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely horrible for it's advertised useage
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I competed in a Tough Mudder challenge this weekend and wanted to get a camera to document my adventure that would be able to handle getting submerged in water a few times and still let me get some pictures or video of the fun.I carried this in my hand or in the side pocket of my shorts throughout the 10 miles on the mountain and it spent approximately 15 minutes max being submerged in water, and got wet (water splashed onto it or onto me) several more times. It's rated to be *waterproof* to at least 10ft (I think the data sheet says 14.9) so I figured never going more than 6ft in water should be fine. I was terribly wrong on that point.After the first time crawling through muddy water on my belly (12" deep) with the camera in my pocket, its lens was fogged up and it wouldn't turn on. I pulled it out again later and it turned on, took a couple of videos and pictures, but the LCD on the back was fogged and appeared to have water inside, but the lens was now clear. I was already concerned at this point but shouldn't have been, as it never worked again!CONS:Almost everything regarding its toughness. I followed every instruction and it had water inside from the first few moments of getting wet, there are no rubber seals or gaskets around the battery/SD card compartment, nothing to tighten down to make sure it's sealed, just a tiny latch/switch that you have to make sure is locked (which I did).Not waterproof, this is completely false. I got so much water inside it that I do not think I will be able to pull the few images I think were taken off of the memory card.Please, if you are going to do anything remotely active that involves more than a few ounces of water, DO NOT buy this camera. I'll be testing out Costco's return policy as I am going to take this thing back tomorrow. If anyone finds a decent priced point and shoot that is waterproof, please respond here. I think I will be getting the Go Pro HD next, tons of folks had those and had no issues with them.PROS:It came with a spiffy case. That's it, nothing else performed as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Elaine R "Elaine R"
Reviews.Content: We used the Fujifilm XP all summer at the lake that we keep our boat at, we also took this camera on a Southern Caribbean cruise. We went snorkeling and took some great pictures of sea turtles, fish & sea urchins. It worked great! Just make sure that your battery compartment is locked tight, push it down with some pressure and be sure it clicks locked. We are very happy with the underwater camera & the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great for a week
Reviews.Author: Orfie "orfie"
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I have a Canon Rebel SLR. That being said, the picture quality of this camera was average, and its versatility was below average (I realize I cannot compare my SLR to a point and shoot, however the pictures were often pixelated and not always sharp. My sisters have point and shoots, a samsung 10.1mp and a kodak 10.1mp, and this camera did not out perform either). I bought this camera for my trip to Cancun and to take underwater pictures. I loved this camera for the first 5 days of the trip, it did well enough underwater to get some fun pictures. I swam in a Cenote, an underground river, pools, ocean and this camera performed well. However, on the 6th day, I was in the ocean and pulled it out to find it had flooded and no longer works. I am greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not very impressed
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Costco for a trip to Sea World.  Quality of photos in anything less than full sunlight is pretty terrible.  Remember: megapixels don't mean squat if you don't have a decent lens, auto-focus system, processor, memory card, etc.  If I had to do it again would buy a disposable waterproof digital for the day at the park, or shell out the extra bucks for a better waterproof camera.  On the plus side, the video is OK, and it's pretty cool to be able to take video underwater at the pool.  Even in the pool, though, the battery compartment door popped open without warning--it was sheer luck that water did not get into the inside of the camera. I pay extra-special attention to closing the door now.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: kenmen "KM"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my grandson as a gift. He loves it. He takes underwater shots in the bathtub. He records a lot of video, so he can run through a battery charge in a few hours. I ended up buying one for myself to keep in the motorcycle, since my other camera is a digital SLR, and doesn't do video. The camera with a car charger and I'm good to go.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: tracieszcz
Reviews.Content: First off, if I could give this camera zero stars I would. We got this camera as a wedding present to be used on our honeymoon in the Dominican Republic. Luckily we packed two cameras, this camera only lasted about an hour. We took it out in the ocean, was under water only about 1 foot and afterwards camera read "card error" and we lost all photos on the memory card. Also water had seeped into the battery compartment and under the flash. Currently trying to exchange it because it is past the return time. Not a happy customer, will probably never use or count on this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Bad Picture Quality AND not waterPROOF...
Reviews.Author: Howard C. Trumbull "They Call Me Rev"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Fuji XP20 last October after a long summer of digital photography at beaches and pools and being worried about my digital camera. I've owned Fuji's all of my life and have had great luck with them. This one, not so much. First, I've not been really happy with the image quality but I figured that since it was too "red", the large amount of "blue" in a pool or ocean would correct that well I didn't get to find out! I finally remembered to take it to the pool this past weekend and I took 2 pics outside of the water, 3 pics in the water and then it shut off. Hmm, strange, it is waterproof so this should not be a problem! I took the camera out of the pool and into the shade to find there was water in the LCD and shutter! GREAT! I get the SD card out and review what it captured. 2 pic out of the water is all it captured. So, I've emailed Fuji about this and what they plan to do about it. I'll update this review once they update me.

Reviews.Title: Stay away!!!
Reviews.Author: Vishal Sharma
Reviews.Content: The camera touts to be waterproof up to 16.4 ft, really? Recently, we took the camera to Cancun, Mexico for our annual vacation. We got to the hotel, changed, picked up the camera and when straight down to the beach to take some pics. I used the camera for less than a minute and took two pictures standing in waist deep water when 3-4 ft wave hit me. The camera never left my hand and never knocked against any thing. When I tried to use it again, boom, gone!!! No power, no nothing! Luckily, we had a second camera that we used for the rest of the vacation. This doesn't do what it advertises to do at all. If you want a camera that lasts 45 seconds, buy this, otherwise, please stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought December 4, 2012.
Reviews.Author: Mr Z
Reviews.Content: well it lasted till 8/17/13. my son accidently dropped it 4' and top silver plastic bezel cracked and center snapshot button also. Its rated for a higher fall. everything would still work but no one will sell me the replacement parts. They want it sent in to repair or local repair. well @ $25 for parts and $60 to put on-That's $85 to put towards another camera- the Fujifilm FinePix XP100 is on amazon for $99 on sale!!! lol  and who would of thought of buying the drop and spill warranty on a camera built for that.Fujifilm FinePix XP100 Digital Cameraby Fujifilm3.1 out of 5 stars  See all reviews (69 customer reviews) | 3 answered questionsList Price: $229.95Price: $99.99  Eligible for free shipping with Amazon Prime.You Save: $129.96 (57%)In Stock.Ships from and sold by Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Rugged as a brick...and fully as functional
Reviews.Author: Daniel Drobnis
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a once-in-a-lifetime trip to New Guinea and surrounding islands, with hopes of capturing some images snorkeling off coral reefs in the pristine waters.  Ordered it in plenty of time, tested it in the sink for waterproof capabilities, took a few test shots.  Everything fine.Got to New Guinea, went to fire it up for the first day's snorkel--dead as a (doornail, mackeral, choose your metaphor--it could not be deader than this thing.)So, since I had used forethought and ordered in plenty of time--it was out of warranty by the time I got back.Camera, battery, charger...who knows?  Don't make my mistake--keep yourself and your wallet far away from this thing.  My only (further) regret is that I cannot award negative stars.

Reviews.Title: best underwater camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Chris Ann Herron
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a gift to my step son and he loves it!  he said its the best underwater camera ever.  Even the photos & videos taken out of the water were remarkable.  There are reviews saying that the lid ot the battery keeps on opening.  it's not true. the one we got stays there and kept the battery and the camera safe and secure underwater.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Lost Boys
Reviews.Content: This camera tends to leak and according to FUJI personnel and reviews like others on Amazon, Fuji knows it and yet they still don't stand behind their product. (I can only assume that's why they keep coming out with new models with newly designed doors.)If you are unfortunate enough to buy this camera, use it immediately after purchasing (a lot), because if your experience is like mine (and other reviewers on this page), it may leak or have other problems. Based on my experience, if it's out of warranty,even after only using it a few times, FUJI will not replace or upgrade it without charging you almost full price for doing so ($116.- $150.) Two thumbs down for this camera and for FUJI. I opted to eat the couple hundred dollars I paid for this piece of junk rather than spend the ridiculous amount of money required to upgrade to a newer model with similar reviews. I am NEVER buying a FUJI camera again! NEVER! (This was not a fluke. It was the second and last of these cameras for me. Both quit working after only a few times using them).

Reviews.Title: Yes
Reviews.Author: Godslayer333 "Godslayer333"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad for christmas, he likes it, so i'm happy, and it's practically indestructible. He takes it with him on his outdoor trips.

Reviews.Title: UGH Pain in the A$$
Reviews.Author: Jenny DB "Jenny DB"
Reviews.Content: I am on my SECOND repair with FujiFilm for this camera. Photo quality was amazing at first but after a few months the camera just didn't seem to be focusing right. Then even though this camera is supposed to be drop proof shock proof etc. it just stopped working after I dropped it once. Sent it to FujiFilm and they fixed the lens error and I took it snorkeling with whale sharks ... only 1-2 ft under water even though it's rated for much deeper, well water got in the screen and it stopped working, so I missed the opportunity of a lifetime to snap pictures with these beautiful animals. Now the camera is back with FujiFilm again. WHAT A PAIN!!! Next time I'm returning it to Amazon and they can deal with the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy with camera
Reviews.Author: j
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically because it was waterproof and I was going on a cruise.  First time I used it in the ocean the door flipped opened and, no wonder, stopped working.  Had to deal with the company I bought it from and they helped me with Fuji to make a claim. Had to send the camera to Fuji for them to look at it and see if they could repair it.  They ended up sending me a new replacement camera.  About a year later I used it again in the water (first time in the water since the new one) and with in 5mins of being in the water it just stopped working.  None of the doors opened up.  Now it is out of warranty with the company I bought it from and now trying to see what they and Fuji will do for me as I am NOT happy with this camera at all, why would I spend money on a camera specifically for water but can't use it in the water?.  The only times it was in the water it stopped working!

Reviews.Title: WORKED FOR 1 YEAR!
Reviews.Author: BGH46
Reviews.Content: My sister and I bought this same camera 12/2011.  We are cruisers and these cameras were purchased specifically for trips to Caribbean beaches.  It was easy to use in and out of the water and at first I was very pleased with its performance.  However, at the last beach I accidentally dropped it in the sand and then the buttons began to stick.  I rinsed it under clear tap water to possibly clean out any sand residue in the buttons.  The camera buttons started to work again and I thought this fixed the "sand" problem. But the camera was no longer reliable and would only take a picture after pushing the button several times...if it worked at all.  Then I took it underwater at the beach (and I did not drop it in the sand again), the buttons began to stick again and water began to leak in the lens and LCD screen.  I have dried the camera out thinking this might correct the problem (I try to think positive), but now the camera no longer works at all.  My sister's camera is still working, but she has not used it as much as I have used mine and she has not dropped it in the sand.  I'm just waiting to see how long her camera lasts.  I did not rate the Fujifilm XP20 as a total "I hate or dislike" camera `cause it did is last a year, but I really thought it was more reliable than this.

Reviews.Title: Good for underwater.
Reviews.Author: allison
Reviews.Content: I would never buy this as my sole point and shoot camera, I have a panasonic lumix and a Canon Rebel XSI. However, for my trip to hawaii it was perfect. I didn't want to spend a lot and I loved the look of it and it worked very well underwater. I didn't have any problem with leakage; as long as you check very carefully that everything is secure it shouldn't be an issue. I took it snorkeling several times, including at night with manta rays. My video quality wasn't the best but it was decent and definitely worth the buy to have it over nothing. I also took it ziplining with me which was perfect as it was raining. The only complaint I have is that you can hear the zooming in and out in the video and there was a lot of "noise" as well, but I suppose underwater audio can only be so good. If you want a camera for every day use I would NOT suggest you buy this.  If you are going on a trip where the camera could get wet this is a good purchase. Really the only con was I was always worried water would get in, It didn't but I was worried after reading all the reviews. A family member came with a more updated model of this camera, it had several upgraded features to prevent leakage. If you can afford it I would suggest getting the newer model instead. If not,  this is a good camera as long as you're careful!

Reviews.Title: It's OK for the price
Reviews.Author: JosephU "JosephU"
Reviews.Content: I knew I wasn't getting the best camera ever. Just bought it for a trip I was doing. Worked good and still works.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: C. Brown "Rocky Mt. Reader"
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Costco to replace an old Olympus Stylus tough that we lost. We used it for a home-made photobooth at our wedding and it worked fine. However, the first time we got into the water (on our honeymoon in Puerto Vallarta) it began to malfunction and show signs of water (ei, water drops in the battery/memory card area, fogging lens) and malfunctioning on-and-off. Our old stylus was fabulous and never had so many problems. Luckily we also brought along a kodak playsport video camera on the trip- if we'd left it up to this camera we'd have no documentation of our honeymoon.  Had to return this item with discontent.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Experience
Reviews.Author: Marian
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras for my daughters in January.  (To be fair, I'm not positive that this is the right model, but they are Fujifilm Waterproof/Shock/Dust/Freeze Proof cameras, 5x optical zoom, look just like the pictures.  But I can't turn them on, and the exact model number is not printed on the camera.)  We had to return both cameras within the first week because the waterproofing didn't work.  We exchanged them for brand new ones, and were extra careful to make sure they were fully latched to avoid the water problems.  We also soaked them per the instructions.  In the last month or two, both cameras have stopped working altogether.  One won't charge or turn on at all.  The warranty was only 90 days, so we are out of luck.  What a rip off!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy...not waterprooof
Reviews.Author: g2
Reviews.Content: Don't buy...this camera is not waterproof. The door for battery doesn't stay shut and the camera gets ruined. Don't waste your money or your time with Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara
Reviews.Author: Pedro A. Rodriguez M "PEDRO R"
Reviews.Content: Resistente y la probe en el agua funciona estupendamente, la recomiendo, en cuanto a la tienda es muy responsable la entrega fue exacta

Reviews.Title: WTF?
Reviews.Author: Icelanddad
Reviews.Content: Shot over 900 images, and 110 were ghost-lke files.  They show up on Sd card as big files, BUt are un-viewable and not fixable to view (both Jpgs and movie files too (.avi). But a real camera, like a canon 60D. Lost shots of giant crater hverfall, where Tom$ cvruise filmed Oblivion in June 2012. Waaaeh!!!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: delani 123
Reviews.Content: i love this camera it works so well! and at these prices i can afford to perchase accsesories and such foe the camera as well!  so if u r debating wether or not to buy it  i would because it is definitly worth it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: afrisch
Reviews.Content: The camera was purchased for a Christmas gift; therefore, has not been used yet.But, packaging was great and I believe the product is new, so don't expect any difficulties with it.  Seller was prompt in sending.

ProductInfo.Features:
14MP
Fujinon 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom (28 - 140mm)
4-Way Protection: Waterproof - 16.5 ft, Shockproof - 5ft, Freeze Proof 14F, Dust Proof
HD Movies 720p with sound
Dual Image Stabilization
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix XP20 Orange 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom - Orange
